metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3713 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
The msr_mtrr_valid function in arch/x86/kvm/mtrr.c in the Linux kernel before 4.6.1 supports MSR 0x2f8, which allows guest OS users to read or write to the kvm_arch_vcpu data structure, and consequently obtain sensitive information or cause a denial of service (system crash), via a crafted ioctl call. David Matlack discovered that the Kernel-based Virtual Machine (KVM) implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly restrict variable Memory Type Range Registers (MTRR) in KVM guests. A privileged user in a guest VM could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) in the host, expose sensitive information from the host, or possibly gain administrative privileges in the host.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3713` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.2.0-36-generic - 4.2.0-36.42~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-36.42~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-36-lowlatency - 4.2.0-36.42~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-36-powerpc-e500mc - 4.2.0-36.42~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-36-powerpc-smp - 4.2.0-36.42~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-36-powerpc64-emb - 4.2.0-36.42~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-36-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-36.42~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-36-generic - 4.2.0-36.42~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-22-generic - 4.4.0-22.40~14.04.1

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support sbeattie> x86 issue only

criterions.comment: linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-wily package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-36.42~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-22.40~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-22.40~14.04.1').
